author: Oscar Wilde
title: The Happy Prince and Other Stories
description: I am so clever that sometimes I dont understand a single word of what I am saying.

author: J. K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
description: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

author: Neil Gaiman
title: The Sandman, Vol. 9: The Kindly Ones
description: Have you ever been in love? Horrible isnt it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up.

author: Vladimir Nabokov
title: Pnin
description: His life was a constant war with insensate objects that fell apart, or attacked him, or refused to function, or viciously got themselves lost as soon as they entered the sphere of his existence.

author: Amy Chua
title: Battle Hymn of the Tiger Mother
description: My Western friends who consider themselves strict make their children practice their instruments thirty minutes each day. An hour at most. For a Chinese mother, the first hour is the easy part. Its hours two and three that get tough.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A ladys imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
